abstract: AT&T’s $1.19 billion acquisition agreement with Leap Wireless includes two strong provisions intended to protect the deal from competing bids. Are such merger protections likely to become more commonplace?
snippet: AT&T’s $1.19 billion acquisition agreement with Leap Wireless includes two strong provisions intended to protect the deal from competing bids. Are such merger protections likely to become more commonplace?
lead_paragraph: The $1.19 billion AT&T acquisition of Leap Wireless International is an illustration in how far bidders and acquisition targets can go these days to protect against competing offers.

headline.main: Ways to Muscle Out Competing Deal Offers
